Package fr.cnrs.iees.omugi.graph

Interface EdgeSet<E extends Edge>

Type Parameters:
E - The Edge subclass used to construct the graph
All Superinterfaces:
fr.cnrs.iees.omhtk.Textable
All Known Subinterfaces:
Graph<N,​E>
All Known Implementing Classes:
ALGraph, TreeGraph
public interface EdgeSet<E extends Edge> extends fr.cnrs.iees.omhtk.Textable

The set of edges of a graph. Graph G is defined as G=(N,E,f) where N is a set of nodes, E a set of edges connecting the nodes, and f the incidence function mapping every edge to a pair of nodes.

Some graph implementations (e.g. Tree) may have no use for this interface since their edges are implicit.

An EdgeSet must be associated with an EdgeFactory.

Author:
Jacques Gignoux - 14 mai 2019

      Read-only accessor to all Edges.

      an immutable collection of all Edges

    • edgeFactory

      EdgeFactory edgeFactory()
      The edge factory used to instantiate edges for this edge set / graph.
      Returns:
      the edge factory

    • addEdge

      default void addEdge​(Node start, Node end, E edge)
      Use this method to add edges into an edge set. This method is invoked by EdgeFactory.makeEdge(...) methods at edge instantiation time, so that there is usually no need to call it explicitly.
      Parameters:
      start - The start node of the edge.
      end - The end node of the edge.
      edge - the edge to add to the graph

    • removeEdge

      default void removeEdge​(Node start, Node end, E edge)
      Use this method to remove an edge from an edge set.
      Parameters:
      start - The start node of the edge.
      end - The end node of the edge.
      edge - the edge to remove from the graph
